fullText: But after all the temporizing and flatulating earlier, the last-minute arrival of a point seemed, well, beside the point. Had I laughed more than twice in the play’s previous 119 minutes, I might even have found it funny.

keyPhrases.quote: Had I laughed more than twice in the play's previous 119 minutes
after all the temporizing and flatulating earlier
the last-minute arrival of a point seemed, well, beside the point

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Critic explicitly states they only laughed twice in nearly two hours, describing the show as pointless with crude humor and poor pacing. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses strong disappointment with the play's humor and overall effectiveness, indicating a clear rejection of the production.

bwwExcerpt: But to suggest something is not to achieve it, and though “The Cottage” operates like a farce it only rarely achieves a farce’s liftoff. That’s when the pressure on the characters becomes so intense that it initiates a kind of verbal and physical fission.
showScoreExcerpt: “...though ‘The Cottage’ operates like a farce it only rarely achieves a farce’s liftoff. That’s when the pressure on the characters becomes so intense that it initiates a kind of verbal and physical fission.”
